type.name: section
type.title: Short title.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Short title. 1. This Act may be cited as the National Equivalency Board Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the National Equivalency Board Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Interpretation. 2. In this Act  Board means the National Equivalency Board established by section 3;  chairman means the chairman of the Board;  educational institution means school, college, university or other place of learning;  employers includes government departments and any person engaged in the hiring, employing or superintending the labour or service of any employee;  qualification means degree, diploma or certificate granted by any educational institution.

type.name: section
type.title: Establishment of the Board.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Establishment of the Board. 3. There is hereby established a board to be known as the National Equivalency Board.
type.description: There is hereby established a board to be known as the National Equivalency Board.

type.name: section
type.title: Constitution of the Board.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Constitution of the Board. 4. (1) The Board shall consist of seventeen members who shall be appointed to the Board by the Minister from representatives supplied by the organisations specified in the Schedule.  (2) Each organisation specified in the Schedule LAWS OF GUYANA National Equivalency Board Cap. 39:10 5  L.R.O. 1/2012          Functions of the Board.                                        shall supply to the Minister the names of not less than two representatives.  (3) The Minister may by order amend the Schedule.

type.name: section
type.title: Functions of the Board.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Functions of the Board. 5. type.name: section
type.title: Provision of information.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Provision of information. 6. (1) The Board may require employers or any educational institution to provide information necessary for the proper discharge of the functions of the Board.  (2) In the case of a failure by employers or any educational institution to comply with subsection (1), the chairman shall report the failure to the Minister, and the Minister may take such measures as are necessary or expedient to secure compliance with the subsection.

type.name: section
type.title: Decisions of the Board.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Decisions of the Board. 7. Notwithstanding the provisions of any Act to the contrary, decisions, evaluations and findings of the Board shall be binding.
type.description: Notwithstanding the provisions of any Act to the contrary, decisions, evaluations and findings of the Board shall be binding.

type.name: section
type.title: Implementation of decisions.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Implementation of decisions. 8. Where the Board makes any decision, evaluation or finding in the discharge of its functions under this Act, the Board shall decide on measures for the implementation of the decision evaluation or finding.
type.description: Where the Board makes any decision, evaluation or finding in the discharge of its functions under this Act, the Board shall decide on measures for the implementation of the decision evaluation or finding.

type.name: section
type.title: Appointment of chairman and deputy chairman.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Appointment of chairman and deputy chairman. 9. (1) The Minister shall, after consultation with the members of the Board, appoint one of the members of the Board to be the chairman.  (2) The Board shall appoint one of the members of the Board to be the deputy chairman.

description.description: The Minister shall, after consultation with the members of the Board, appoint one of the members of the Board to be the chairman.
The Board shall appoint one of the members of the Board to be the deputy chairman.

type.name: section
type.title: Duties of chairman.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Duties of chairman. 10. (1) The chairman shall be responsible for giving guidance to the Board for the purpose of the discharge of its functions and for the management, organisation and discipline of the Board.  (2) If the chairman is absent or is unable to act or if the office is vacant the deputy chairman shall discharge the functions of chairman.

type.name: section
type.title: Duties of the Public Service Ministry.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Duties of the Public Service Ministry. 12. The Public Service Ministry shall  (a) provide a Secretary to the Board who shall be paid such remuneration as the Minister thinks fit; (b) provide such other services as are required by the Board for the proper discharge of its functions; and  (c) pay to members of the Board such remuneration or allowances as the Minister thinks fit.

type.name: section
type.title: Experts.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Experts. 13. The Board may, at any time, retain the services of experts and other professional persons (including consultants) having specialized knowledge relevant to the Boards functions and responsibilities, and may pay such persons such remuneration in respect thereof as the Board, with the approval of the Minister, may determine.

type.name: section
type.title: Appeals.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Appeals. 14. (1) An appeal may be made to the Minister in respect of any evaluation, decision or finding of the Board, and any such appeal shall be made in writing within fourteen days after the day on which such evaluation, decision or finding was made.  (2) Where an appeal is made under subsection (1) in respect of any evaluation, decision or finding, the Minister shall have power to confirm, vary or cancel the evaluation, decision or finding.

type.name: section
type.title: Preservation of secrecy.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Preservation of secrecy. 16. (1) Except for the purpose of the discharge of his functions or when lawfully required to do so by any court or under the provisions of any law, a member of the Board or the Secretary of the Board shall not disclose any information which he has acquired in the discharge of his functions.  (2) Where a person referred to in subsection (1) contravenes the provisions of that subsection the Board shall report such contravention to the Minister who may take such steps as are necessary or expedient to deal with the contravention.

type.name: section
type.title: Disclosure of interest.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Disclosure of interest. 17. (1) Where the interest of a member of the Board is likely to be directly or indirectly affected by a decision of the Board, the member shall disclose the nature of the interest at the first meeting of the Board at which he is present after the relevant facts have come to his knowledge.  (2) Where there is a disclosure under subsection (1), the Secretary of the Board shall record in the minutes of the Board a full account of the disclosure; and the member of the Board making the disclosure shall, unless the Board otherwise directs, not be present or take part in the deliberations or vote at any meeting during the time when the Board is deciding the matter in which the member has disclosed an interest.  (3) For the purpose of this section, where the interest of parents, spouse or children of a member of the Board is likely to be directly or indirectly affected by a decision of the Board, the interest shall be deemed to be the interest of the member.

type.name: section
type.title: Names of members to be published in the Gazette.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Names of members to be published in the Gazette. 19. The names of all members of the Board as first constituted and every change in membership of the Board shall be published in the Gazette.

type.name: section
type.title: Protection of members.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Protection of members. 20. No action, suit, prosecution or other proceedings shall be brought or instituted personally against any member of the Board in respect of any act done bona fide in pursuance of the execution or intended execution of his duties under this Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Annual reports.
type.context: NATIONAL EQUIVALENCY BOARD ACT under Annual reports. 21. The Board shall within two months after the end of each year of the existence of the Board prepare and submit to the Minister a report dealing with the activities of the Board during the year and containing information that relates to the operation, policies and effectiveness of the Board.
